comment: I learned a lot from Professor Zhang especially when I went to her office hours. Math Stat 1 is challenging, but her explanations were clear to the point that I understood the material. I'm just glad it was in person because next semester the class will be online and I'm not an online learner, so I'm glad I take care of it before it's too late.

She's easy to reach when you have questions, though assignments are easy to understand. Sometimes the lecture videos can be a little bit of a drag (no longer than 35mins though) but it's nothing hard. She walks you through a lot of the assignments, so it's hard to do badly on most of the things in this class. I recommend her
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class is really easy, and the exams were online. She also does in class assignments which she provides the answers for you. The homework's are really easy to do to. It is such an easy A.

the class is super easy if you pay attention and show up to lectures. part of your grade is based on attendance, but you really do get a lot if you go to class. she will answer any quiz question or homework question until you understand. she really wants people to do well and seems genuinely excited about the material she teaches.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: very easy going prof, attendence does make up part of you grade for inclass assignments, exams are lockdown browser but you can have printed notes plus she gives you ALOT of time to take it. Theres extra credit assignments and all that. great BIOSTAT prof

Honestly, the accent isn't even the problem. Its easy to understand her, she's flexible. However, her lectures had minimum teaching on how to do the content. At times during her lecture recordings she just pauses as if she's confused or is trying to find/remember the answers. Last, a lot of her questions were poorly written and made no sense.

common sense class! As long as you show up you'll get an A! We use "r-studio", but we learn how to use that in class and it's super easy. You can use your notes on the test and we go over the answers to the quizzes in class so everyone makes a 100 on those. 100% recommend!

She is truly amazing! I had her for biostatistics (STAT 3125) at KSU. Everything comes straight from the powerpoints and in class quizzes. She goes over everything and wants you to succeed. Her exams were open note as long as the notes were hand written. She is incredibly kind and is willing to work with her students. Absolutely recommend her!!

Absolutely Amazing!!! If you have the chance take Her! OMG Amazing! SO much Extra Credit! Open Notes tests and Open note finals! She has videos for EVERYTHING! She will work with you on everything. You can even get out of the final. Absolutely would recommend!

Had her for grad level longitudinal and now have her for multivariate. Can't teach at all and heavy accent. No exams either, just homeworks and projects. It's complex material, but even if you don't understand it, it's fine since you wont be graded too harshly. She can be funny and she's very nice. Not a good professor though.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Very sweet & smart lady, but for the life of her can't "teach" the material. Thick accent to the point of not being to understand her at times. Super easy grader though. If you just want an A or B and don't care to actually learn the material, take her. If you actually want to "learn" the material, don't take her. Had to teach myself w/the book.
